Message 95 of 287
Specific to the 300k... I am running some numbers.
Today we are in the 35% bracket. I need to sell 200k to pay off everything and move things around. Then, if I sell the 300K, we will push to the next
bracket, and our tax bill will go up. Below is my calculation based on that.
<<Caveat: I know I am mixing annual income with realized gains and need to distinguish:>>
• Ordinary Income (Your salary: $226,000)
• Capital Gains (which are taxed differently)
• The equalization payment tax treatment
• Tax rate on past sales based on cost basis
